radiographic_examinations.findings: In the right lower quadrant, the appendix is fluid filled, has a hyperemic wall and is significantly dilated up to 1.9 cm. Periappendiceal stranding is also present. The lung bases are clear of nodules or effusions. Minor dependent atelectatic change is seen. Liver enhances homogeneously with no focal liver lesions. Gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and bilateral kidneys are unremarkable. No evidence of hydronephrosis, stones, or masses. Abdominal aorta shows extensive calcifications with no evidence of aneurysmal dilation. No abdominal lymphadenopathy noted.
